comments.creator: dhorner.bugs@gmail.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.7; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 20110804030150

Steps to reproduce:

As per bug 682334, we have created a video that will be used in AMO and the Add-ons manager to introduce new Firefox users to the benefits of using Add-ons for Firefox.

Once the localisation is complete, this needs to be turned into universal subtitles for non English markets.
comments.author: dhorner.bugs@gmail.com

comments.creator: smalolepszy@gmail.com
comments.text: UniSub is at the same time a technology used to display subtitles and an authoring tool used to create them.  The localization takes place in the open on their website -- are you okay with this?
comments.author: smalolepszy@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: UniSub is at the same time a technology used to display subtitles and an authoring tool used to create them.  The localization takes place in the open on their website -- are you okay with this?

comments.creator: dhorner.bugs@gmail.com
comments.author: dhorner.bugs@gmail.com
comments.text: So subtitles can only be added once the video is live... not before we push it?
comments.raw_text: So subtitles can only be added once the video is live... not before we push it?

UniSubs require that we upload the video somewhere where it can be accessed through a direct and public URL.  We can hold off the launch of the campaign, or not display the video on our websites, but it will be still available for everyone to watch on http://universalsubtitles.org/.
